active_learning.discussion_prompt: To what extent is resource exhaustion a deliberate security attack versus an accidental performance issue in multi-tenant clouds? Use examples from AWS (e.g., 2017 AWS Customer DoS incident), Azure, or real incidents to debate the balance between strict isolation and resource efficiency. Consider security implications like DoS amplification.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Security Architecture Vulnerabilities (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security Architecture And Engineering > Security Architecture Vulnerabilities > System Architecture Vulnerabilities > Virtualization Architecture Vulnerabilities > Resource Exhaustion in Multi-Tenant Environments). Generate 30-50 high-quality flashcards using the exact schema provided. Cover all learning objectives across Bloom's Taxonomy (REMEMBER to CREATE), active learning concepts (noisy neighbor analogy, Kubernetes mitigations, DoS examples), and 4 scaffolding layers. Ensure completeness: Include expanded operational costs (monitoring/auto-scaling overhead), mitigations (quotas, alerts), sources (ResearchGate Cloud Frameworks, MS Learn Azure multi-tenant, AWS SaaS Isolation). Incorporate: - Prior knowledge: DoS/DDoS, virtualization. - Real examples: 2017 AWS Customer DoS, Kubernetes namespaces. - Voter priorities: Measurable objectives, diagrams (describe), peer activities. Follow flashcard schema strictly: - Varied types balanced by Bloom/layer. - MCQs: 1 correct + 3 distractors per protocol. - Explanations: Tie to layers/objectives/active learning. Output ONLY a JSON array of flashcards, no extra text.
